reviews.text: From the start of my attempt to book a room, I knew this was a good lodging choice. Unni-Marie is one of the most accommodating hosts in the travel industry. Originally scheduled to arrive from Flam at 5pm, we decided to take the early ferry and arrived just before 8am. We only hoped to leave our bags and head out for the day, but Unni-Marie went out of her way to check us in early and even had us take breakfast while our room was being prepared. Everyone in the family works hard to provide an enjoyable stay. There is a car sent to meet the ferries in order for guests to avoid taking their bags on the short walk to the hotel and they bring the luggage back to the docks when you leave. Unni-Marie is very knowledgable about the ferry schedules, hiking options, and nearby attractions.
reviews.title: Superb Service and Attitude!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are basic, but clean, and the heated bathroom floor was appreciated after a long hike. We booked too late for a fjord view, but it didn't detract from our stay. Great hiking options are available after a ten to fifteen minute walk through the town. The nearby Kviknes Hotel serves a Scandinavian Buffet that is really worth the cost just to try. The food choices were excellent and delicious and the view from the dining room was incredible. A true five-star experience in a beautiful setting!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't even look for other lodging options if I returned. I'd only check to make sure Unni-Marie's family is still running the hotel!
reviews.title: Great location on the fjord

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Balestrand Hotel for two nights. We requested a room with the fjord view and it was definitely worth it. The room was clean and basic. It was very quiet. The only problem was that the water from the shower could go between the tub and the wall, and caused a small puddle on the floor. There was no television, which seemed appropriate given the setting. The breakfast was good. The staff were very accommodating. We especially appreciated the pick-up and later, delivery of our suitcases to the dock. Balestrand is a nice, attractive community which gives you the feeling that you are definitely on vacation.
reviews.title: Beds and bathtub were great, view was awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner was wonderfully helpful, even helping us make reservations for the mid-fjord ferry change on our way back to the NinN route. The place is simple, but the rooms are spotless and the bathroom floor is heated, very foot friendly! We stayed on the fjord side and loved the view. Would stay again in a flash.
reviews.title: Intense and constantly evident effort

reviews.text: The rooms are nice, the view is fantastic and the service great. What more can you ask for!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Balestrand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything has been well described in past reviews, there is not much more to be said! What is most remarkable about the hotel is the level of service provided by Unni Marie and her family. While my wife and I are very low-maintenance travelers, we observed a large group with many needs being attended to in a manner that went beyond our expectations.
reviews.title: great family run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While in Balestrand, I would highly recommend staying at this hotel, and having dinner at the Kviknes!
reviews.title: Perfect place for Sognfjord

reviews.text: A bit late writing this review, but we had an excellent stay at Balestrand Hotel this past summer. The hosts were very helpful, and while it wasn't as fancy a locale as some of our other stays in Norway (the breakfast was excellent, but rather basic) it was a perfect (Norway-level) budget-friendly quality lodging.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with basic facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining options are limited in Balestrand, and the staff at the Hotel was helpful in making the best choices. We ultimately tried almost everything, but would encourage other guests to rely on the guidance of your hosts.
reviews.title: A charming family run hotel

reviews.text: Our family had the pleasure of staying at the Balestrand Hotel, this summer. Balestrand, a quaint little town, is well worth the stop. Much quieter and less touristy than Flam. And a central point to spend more time exploring the fjords.
reviews.title: Excellent family run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an easy, few minute walk from the dock and Uni Marie and her family are the perfects hosts. Nothing is too much trouble for them. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. The rooms are fairly basic, but very comfortable and clean. And if you are able to get a room on the fjord side, the views are spectacular. You can't go wrong staying here.
reviews.title: Fantastic fjord view from the balcony

reviews.text: I can highly recommend doing the day trip up the Sognefjord to Faederland, the Glacier museum and the two glaciers.
reviews.title: so cute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel deserves a great review. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable, the view unreal, and the breakfast outstanding. Our only regret was not staying two nights in Balestrand. Uni Marie was so helpful in helping us get to places, by driving us to the ferry to Vik (at the last minute) or by giving us directions or telling us where to shop. If we return to Balestrand, which we hope to do, we will return to this hotel. The lawn in front of the Hotel is perfect for a relaxing lunch.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay with lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: super cute hotel in an amazingly beautiful city! It's run by a really nice family so the service is unbeatable and they'll help you with anything you need. I really liked the personal feel here vs the big fancy hotel nearby. it's also more affordable, the breakfast is fantastic, they have free wireless and a computer for you to use, umbrellas should you need them, tons of books and games to play, free tea/coffee 24/7, free rides from the ferry, info on transportation, food, what to do, etc. I even had a sore throat and she just gave me cough medicine that she had for her daughter. Super nice. for anyone going to balestrand, i highly recommend this place =)
reviews.title: Lovely Little Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights, and loved my stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good service, with a beautiful view.
